title: A December election will be a welcome break from the festive fanatics of woke Christmas
text:
As the gap between the American approach to the holidays and ours has closed, a series of sickening lurches between September and Christmas has now become familiar. There I am in Waitrose, looking for the first autumnal apples and I’m tripping over chocolate ghouls. Scary.

But if Halloween can just about be ignored (not by parents of young children, mind, who bemoan the exhausting round of parties now demanded by their sprogs), Christmas is a different story entirely. Christmas now begins practically before one’s summer swimsuit has dried out, first with banks of seasonal nuts and mince pies in supermarkets, then the festive tunes and parties starting soon after.
